document.title: Taglib
document.h1: Tag the block on the provider application
document.p: The block has to be tagged using special HTML comments.
document.h1: Retrieve the block inside a page of the master application
document.p: If using JSP, you can use the tag library. If not, the tool can be used as well directly using java code.
Suppose the block you want to include is inside a page http://localhost:8080/provider/mypage.php
NOTE: do not forget to add the taglib declaration at the beging of the page.

tr.td: includeblock
Include a block from another application
includeBase
Generates a html "base" tag with the URL of the remote page in order for links and resources in the HTML code to work
includeTemplate
Retrieves a block or a complete page from another application and use it as a template. Use enclosed includeparam tags to define parts to replace in the template
includeParam
Defines a part to be replaced in the template by the value of its own body. This tag can only be used inside a includeTemplate tag
block
Generates a tag in the page to delimit a block
replace
Replace a regular expression by its own content. This tag can only be used inside a includeBlock or includeTemplate tag
parameter
Defines a parameter to be added to the request. This tag can only be used inside a includeBlock or includeTemplate tag
template
Generates a tag in the page to delimit a template
param
Generates a tag in the page to delimit a sub part of a template
errorDefinition

In the case of an error matching its error code while retrieving the resource, display the content of its body instead of the error message. This tag can only be used inside a includeBlock or includeTemplate tag
defaultError
In the case of an error while retrieving the resource, display the content of its body instead of the error message

document.p: For more detailed informations, see the javadoc
